Service Details: - Educates and advocates for the protection and rights of children and youth at a national level- Promotes awareness of the issues relating to missing children- Represents and supports the development of existing and future member organizations in all provinces and territories to deliver programs that will reduce the incidence of missing and exploited children- Provides leadership, resources and opportunities to provinces for programs and program development- Increases awareness of missing and exploited children through programs such as the Green Ribbon of Hope Campaign- Develops and maintains relations with organizations internationally- Obtains endorsement of programs from national and international law enforcement and other agencies- Compiles, monitors and distributes national statistics to provincial members and other interested parties
